adjectives.description: determinant (comparative more determinant, superlative most determinant)

entries.meaning: Serving to determine or limit; determinative.
A determining factor; an element that determines the nature of something.
examples: Shields and Young (1993) argue that the budget participation literature "has not produced a coherent nor unified definition" of both the determinants and consequences of budget participation.

entries.meaning: (linear algebra) A scalar that encodes certain characteristics of a given transformation matrix; the unique scalar function over square matrices which is distributive over matrix multiplication, multilinear in the rows and columns, and takes the value 1 for the unit matrix; abbreviated as: det.
examples:
The determinant of a square matrix 
  
    
      
        
          A
          
            (
            n
            )
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle A_{(n)}}
  
 is a function (actually a polynomial function) of the elements 
  
    
      
        
          a
          
            i
            j
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle a_{ij}}
  
 of 
  
    
      
        A
      
    
    {\displaystyle A}
  
.

entries.meaning: (biology) A substance that causes a cell to adopt a particular fate.
(genetics) Something that causes a nuclease to cut at a specified point
